ReportSection.name: Completion Status
ReportSection.tooltip: Evaluation of your report against the reporting rules
ReportSection.Instructions:
Reporting on the January 2014 - December 2014 Activities

This year's reporting is similar to last year's with a few changes due to the fact that, effective April 1st 2014, activity on Phase1 projects officially ended and activity on Phase2 projects officially began. The report narrative section is expected mainly to refer to your activities from January 2014 to December 2014 on Phase2 projects, however, activities related to Phase1 projects can also be reported in relevant text-boxes under Sections A-through-D in the Report page.

The Completion Status page consists of two parts:

  • the NI Progress table, and
  • the HQP Progress table.

The NI Progress table

This table provides an overview of the degree to which your report and the reports of those whose input you require are complete. The following aspects of your report are inspected and critiqued.

  • Regarding the products reported in the Dashboard, the degree to which their descriptions are complete is examined.
  • Regarding the open-ended sections of the Report, the number of text-boxes edited and whether or not any of them exceed the maximum number of characters allowed is examined.
  • The number of your HQP that have reported (vs. the total number of your HQP) is examined.

The HQP Progress table

This table provides information regarding the degree to which your HQP have completed their reports.

  • Clicking on the Report PDF downloads a copy of the HQP report.
  • Clicking on the On-Line Report button enables you to impersonate the HQP in question and view and edit the parts of their report on the projects on which you supervise them (see more on how to impersonate HQP in the FAQ).
  • Clicking on the Notify HQP lets you send a forum notification to the HQP and (if you wish) an email message, with a communication regarding their report.
ReportSection.ReportItem: <style>#hqp_completion table tr:first-child td:first-child {display:none;}</style><table id="hqp_completion" style="background:#ffffff;" cellspacing='1' cellpadding='3' frame='box' rules='all'><tr><th>HQP</th><th>Completion Status</th><th>Actions</th></tr>

ReportItemSet.ReportItem: {$item}

ReportSection.name: Dashboard
ReportSection.tooltip: Overview of this year's activity and productivity
ReportSection.Instructions:
The Dashboard page is designed to provide an overview of a Researcher's activity, throughout the GRAND lifecycle (in the case of the My Profile => Dashboard) or during the current reporting year, January 1st to December 31st (in the case of the My Reports => NI (or HQP) => Dashboard).

The Dashboard page consists of three parts:

  • a Summary of the NI Personal Information,
  • the Top 5 Research Outcomes list, and
  • the Productivity Overview table.

The Top 5 Research Outcomes list

This list identifies the five most important research outcomes of the Researcher throughout the GRAND lifecycle.
  1. In the beginning the list is empty.
  2. When the "Edit Top Research Outcomes" button is pressed, a list of 5 empty labels appears.
  3. Clicking on any of these labels reveals a list of all the Researcher's products; selecting any of these products will associate it with the corresponding label.
  4. Clicking on the "Save Top Research Outcomes" saves the current list, which is rendered in tabular form, as the first part of the Researcher Dashboard page.

The Productivity Overview Table

This table reports the aggregate numbers of all known outcomes co-produced by the Researcher (HQP or NI) organized in rows, where each row corresponds to a Project associated with the Researcher and each column corresponds to a different type of research outcome. More specifically, the table includes the following columns: HQP, Publications, Artifacts, Activities, Presentations, Press, Awards, Multimedia Stories, , and Contributions.

The content of this table is not editable; it simply reflects the information that has already been entered in the Forum through the "Products" tools (to the left of the page). If there is an error in any of the information reported in the dashboard, please edit the corresponding element through the appropriate tool. If the error is in a system-controlled field, please contact support.

In the case of the Profile Dashboard page, the table reports all known outcomes co-produced by the Researcher. In the case of the Report Dashboard page the table reports outcomes that have appeared in the current reporting year or are scheduled to appear on a date within a two-year window in the future.

Note that each row of the table is project-specific and there might be redundancy across some rows, when for example a publication is related to more than one of the Researcher's projects. The 'Total' row only reports unique entities.

Finally, clicking on the link in any of the cells produces a listing below the Dashboard table with all the relevant details.

The Productivity Overview Table Columns

Under HQP, the table reports the HQP who have been listed as being supervised by the Researcher.
Note: This column is not included in the HQP Dashboard.

Under Publications, the table reports any publication co-authored by the Researcher (associated with the Project) including any "to appear" publications. Publications are of different types but, in principle, are documents that appear in archival venues and can be cited.

Under Artifacts, the table reports any artifact co-produced by the Researcher (associated with the Project). This category includes curated data repositories, open-source software, and artistic works.

Under Activities, the table reports any activity in which the Researcher was involved (associated with the Project). This category is meant to include conference or workshop organization and similar activities.

Under Presentations, the table reports any conference presentations, panel statements, seminars etc. given by the Researcher (associated with the Project).

Under Awards, the table reports awards bestowed on the Researcher (associated with the Project).

Under Press, the table reports any press pieces mentioning the Researcher (associated with the Project).

Under Multimedia, the table reports a special case of products that include a multimedia component, such as a video for example, co-produced by the Researcher (associated with the Project). This category is conceived to include video demonstrations (frequently submitted to conferences) or short films produced to illustrate a research activity.

Under Contributions, the table reports cash and in-kind contributions to the Researcher (associated with the Project) by agencies outside GRAND.
Note: This column is not included in the HQP Dashboard.

ReportItemSet.title: Productivity Overview
ReportItemSet.ReportItem:
If there is an error in any of the information reported in the dashboard, please edit the corresponding element through the appropriate tool. If the error is in a system-controlled field, please contact support.
{$item}

ReportSection.name: Report
ReportSection.Instructions:
The intent of Report page is to enable each NI to Report in an open-ended format on his/her activities and accomplishments during the term of the report.

NOTE: Clicking on the second-level headings of this page will cause the page to expand (contract) to show (hide) text boxes in which you can provide your information. The color of the heading indicates whether the text under this heading meets (purple) or exceeds (red) the maximum permitted number of characters.

Time Spent on GRAND Activities

The first section of this page requests that you record
  • the time you have devoted to GRAND-related research activities during the reporting year (hours / week) across the Phase2 projects you are involved with
  • the time you have devoted to GRAND Management (hours / week), and
  • the percentage of time you devote to GRAND-related research relative to your overall research activity.

Executive Summary: Overview of all of my GRAND Activity

(Limit: 3600 characters)

Please provide a brief narrative overview of your accomplishments over the past year, highlighting the ways in which your work is contributing to the NCE program objectives of connecting research and development to the economic and social well-being of Canada.

The executive summary should try to answer the following questions:

  • What are the problems in the real world that your research addresses?
  • Why is it important and to whom is it important to solve these problems?
  • What did you do to address these problems?
  • What evidence do you have that your approaches are good ones?

Assessment: How I contribute towards the NCE Evaluation Criteria

The five NCE Program criteria used in assessing our network are described in detail on the NCE website. Note that these criteria are written to describe the evaluation of the overall network, but we seek information from each researcher that can help build a composite story for progress, success and good management in the area of each criterion. Each of the boxes below has the definition of the NCE criterion that is required for the entire GRAND network, and some suggestions of information to be provided about the research in the project to elicit information relevant to the criterion.

We do not expect each researcher to contribute equally to success against each criterion, but researchers with stronger contributions in several of the criteria will receive a more positive evaluation than those without strong contributions in at least some of the criteria. As such, please give us information about your contributions as measured by these criteria if relevant and significant.

Note that for each of the first four of the five criteria, the text box is "split" into a number of separate fields corresponding to the Phase2 projects with which you are involved and a last field dedicated to all your Phase1 projects. This division is necessary for practical purposes, in order to forward the project-specific information to the corresponding project leader. The project-specific entries will be made available to the applicable project leader for assistance in the preparation of the Project Report. However, no matter the number of projects, each of the five criterion sections will be read as a whole as part of your individual evaluation as a researcher, so please construct your responses accordingly. Please feel free to devote unequal space to the individual projects and to make sure that the overall section reads well and communicates the information you want to communicate about your activity. You can see the overall report by clicking the "Preview" link right next to each of the criterion headings.

A. Excellence of the Research Program

(Reported by Project - Overall Limit (across all projects): 1800 characters)

The Network's research program must be driven to address Canadian needs and problems, and it is therefore expected to be multidisciplinary and multi-sectoral.
In this section you should describe

  • the excellence of your research on a world scale and how it compares to leading efforts in other places;
  • the ways in which your research is tailored to the Canadian context in terms of topic and content, or in terms of needs of Canadian companies or other receptors;
  • the multidisciplinary nature of your work or the research team that gives this work more excellence or potential for impact and how it enables more multi-sectoral applicability of the results and interactions with receptors.

You can reference Products by writing "@Product Title" in the text box and select the product from the drop-down box appearing below the textbox.

B. Development of Highly Qualified Personnel

(Reported by Project - Overall Limit (across all projects): 1800 characters)

The training and retention of HQP is imperative to maximize the effectiveness of the Network's contribution to the wealth, wellness and well being of Canadians. The Training Program proposed by the Network is expected to add value to the formal training initiatives already available through the academic community and should aim at helping students find employment in the Canadian economy (i.e., private sector partners, government, etc.). The multidisciplinary and multi-sectoral nature of a Network should be utilized to provide unique mentorship and training opportunities to maximize HQP retention and integration in all facets of the workforce.

Please use this space to highlight the most significant examples that demonstrate added value to the training of HQP, and comment on the "philosophy" or approach for training HQP to position them well to contribute to digital media in Canada.

  • How did the existence of the project affect the HQP (to get better training or position them better for jobs in Canada)?
  • How have HQP affected the project to create those benefits for other HQP?

Please give examples if possible.

You can reference HQP by writing "@HQP Name" in the text box and select the HQP from the drop-down box appearing below the textbox.

C. Networking and Partnerships

(Reported by Project - Overall Limit (across all projects): 1800 characters)

The Network must demonstrate that it has brought together the key individuals and organizations needed to generate and implement multifaceted solutions to the complex Canadian challenges it is designed to address.

Describe your activities networking with other GRAND researchers and projects, and researchers outside of GRAND. Describe your involvement with receptor organizations, industry partners and Receptor Community Champions.

How have these connections accelerated your research or broadened its scope and applicability?

You can reference Project Members by writing "@Project Member Name" in the text box and select the member from the drop-down box appearing below the textbox.

D. Knowledge and Technology Exchange and Exploitation

(Reported by Project - Overall Limit (across all projects): 1800 characters)

NCE Networks and Centres are expected to generate social and economic benefits by ensuring the rapid flow of ideas and innovations from researchers to Canadian receptors. Applicants are expected to demonstrate that the appropriate activities will be undertaken and the appropriate resources allocated to maximize those benefits.

Describe the interactions with receptors, companies, Receptor Community Champions and others in which research challenges and outcomes from your work were discussed or presented.

Describe any student internships, transfers of technology, unique publications, or other evidence of the impact of your research. How has the existence of GRAND, or GRAND personnel, influenced these activities?

E. Management of the Network

(Limit: 1800 characters)

Each Network must have an organizational structure appropriate for the management of the research and business functions of a complex multidisciplinary, multi-institutional program.

Outside of your role as a researcher, describe what role(s) you've had in GRAND, whether or not funded by GRAND, that contribute to the operation or success of the Network. As examples, this might include your role as Theme co-Leader or organizer of a networking event, which in turn might include some aspect of Knowledge and Technology Exchange and Exploitation.

You can reference a GRAND Forum Member by writing "@Member Name" in the text box and select the member from the drop-down box appearing below the textbox.

Outlook: My Plans for 2015 in GRAND

(Report by Phase 2 Project - Overall Limit (across all Phase 2 projects): 3600 characters)

In this section, you should discuss your objectives and plans for your Phase 2 projects for the upcoming year. If you are not currently listed on a project, you should contact the PL or co-PL of that project in order to get added to it.

You can reference Sub-Projects by writing "@Sub-Project Name" in the text box and select the sub-project from the drop-down box appearing below the textbox.

Reflections: Other Aspects of my involvement in GRAND

Benefits of Networking: The value to my research program of my participation in GRAND

(Limit: 600 characters)

In GRAND's reports to the NCE Secretariat, it is helpful to describe ways that the existence of GRAND has benefited researchers and projects. If appropriate, please explain any ways in which GRAND has had a positive impact on your research or projects.

Additional Comments

(Limit: 1800 characters)

If you have any additional comments that you wish to convey to the evaluators, please enter them here. If there have been delays in your research due to medical or other personal issues, you may wish to indicate the impact these have had and your expectations for future progress.

ReportSection.name: Review
ReportSection.Instructions:
The intent of Review page is to provide

  • an online document with all the information currently contained in the report, and
  • an online approximation of what the resulting PDF document will look like.
If you are satisfied with this content, then you can proceed to the final step of the reporting workflow where you can Submit your report to be forwarded to the RMC.

Note that over-limit characters, shown in red in this online document, will not be included in the PDF document.

ReportSection.name: Submit
ReportSection.tooltip: PDF generation and submission to the RMC
ReportSection.Instructions:
Note for NIs: All your PLs have access to your on-line project-specific dashboard rows; your executive summary; and your project-specific comments under criteria A-through-D.

To submit your report, follow the following steps:
  1. Generate a new report for submission: This step will generate a PDF document on the Forum.

  2. Download the PDF report for reviewing: The most recently generated PDF report will be downloaded to your local machine for your records.

  3. Submit the report for evaluation: Make sure you have reviewed the PDF document before submitting.

    Please note:

    • If you need to make a correction to your report that is already submitted, you can generate and submit again.
    • The most recently submitted pdf is used for evaluation.
    • If no pdf has been submitted, then the most recently generated pdf will be used for evaluation instead.
    • If you encounter any issues, please contact support@forum.grand-nce.ca

  4. Download the PDF which will be used for evaluation: To verify that the correct PDF will be used for evaluation, you can download the submitted PDF.
